title: BPPA holds workshop on public procurement rules
body: The Bangladesh Public Procurement Authority held a workshop on the public procurement rules, 2025 and the electronic government procurement at the conference room of deputy commissioner of Rajshahi on Thursday. SM Moin Uddin Ahmed, secretary and chief executive officer of the Bangladesh Public Procurement Authority, attended the workshop as chief guest, said a press release. Md Habibur Rahman, additional divisional commissioner of Rajshahi attended the workshop as special guest, which was presided over by Rajshahi deputy commissioner and district magistrate Afia Akhtar. Managed by the Bangladesh Centre for Communication Programmes, programme director and deputy chief executive officer of BCCP Zeenat Sultana was also present at the workshop. In his speech, BPPA CEO said, ‘The government has made e-GP mandatory through enactment of the Public Procurement Rules, 2025 for which all tenders are now conducted through e-GP.’ ‘The PEs and tenderers are being provided training on the new PPR, 2025 and for that the BPPA is holding workshop in districts and upazilas for creating awareness on the new PPR and the amended PPA, 2006,’ he further said, adding, ‘The PPA, 2006 was amended through an ordinance in 2025 and following that PPR, 2025 was newly formulated instead of the PPR, 2008.’ ‘Both the PPR, 2025 and the amended PPA, 2006 came into effect on September 28, 2025. The BPPA is now disseminating PPR, 2025 across the country through workshops,’ he said. BPPA director Sk Shahidul Islam Shahariar made a presentation on PPR, 2025 focusing various important new rules as well as amended rules and schedules.
